strings.name: Name
strings.reasonForOne: Database not tested or doesn't support
strings.requestedlanguagesorted: Search results in requested language sorted on top
strings.leave: Use metadata linkage as is - no changes to linkage
strings.simple: Use GeoNetwork simple file download service (resources.get)
strings.withdisclaimer: Use GeoNetwork disclaimer and constraints service (file.disclaimer)
strings.title: Title
strings.otherlogins: Allow other users to login from
strings.md.usergrouponly: Only set privileges to user's groups

length.invalidMinSize: The field '{NAME}' must be at least {VALUE} character(s) long
length.invalidMaxSize: The field '{NAME}' must be maximum {VALUE} character(s) long

integer.notInt: The field '{NAME}' must be an integer

alphanum.notAlphaNumeric: The field '{NAME}' must be alphanumeric (starting with a letter)

hostname.notHostName: The field '{NAME}' is not a valid host name

url.notURL: The field '{NAME}' is not a valid URL

ipaddress.notIP: The field '{NAME}' is not a valid IP address

strings.cannotGet: Unable to get the system configuration
strings.cannotSave: Unable to save the system configuration

tips.tip: Unique catalogue identifier. After changing the site identifier, user should update the index and the logo from the administration panel.
Used to identify the installation.

The server's host and port are used to create URLs to the GeoNetwork server. For example, they are used during metadata editing to create resource links and when returning the server's capabilities during a CS/W request.
Please note: you should use the GAST tool to reflect this change inside the metadata.
The network and netmask parameters are used to identify internal connections to GeoNetwork, that is, to identify the intranet group.

If set, during startup GeoNetwork will start the Z39.50 server component. This component uses the ISO23950 protocol.
Please note: restart GeoNetwork to make this change active.

Change the Z39.50 listening port.
Please note: restart GeoNetwork to make this change active.

Influences the behaviour of OAI when parameters from or until are supplied. If set to temporal extent, the temporal extent of the date described by the metadata is searched. If set to modification date, the date at which the metadata was last modified is searched
Please note: restart GeoNetwork to make this change active.

The number of seconds a OAI resultset stays in the cache and can be scrolled using the OAI resumptionToken
Please note: restart GeoNetwork to make this change active.
The number of OAI resultSets that can be stored in the Cache.

If set, this will enable the CSW ISO Profile server functionnality. It will allow other catalogs to harvest it.
Please note: restart GeoNetwork to make this change active.
Configure CSW ISO Profile contact for GetCapabilities operation.
Title
Abstract
Fees
Access constraints
If set, GeoNetwork will display clickable hyperlinks in the metadata.
If set, GeoNetwork will calculate user ratings for metadata from this node only (not distributed among other GeoNetwork nodes).
When enabled, GeoNetwork automatically applies certain fixes when you save metadata.
If set, GeoNetwork will use the provided proxy parameters when accessing remote nodes. For example, this is used during the harvesting.
This is the administrator's email address used to send feedback.
The SMTP host and port parameters are used to send emails to GeoNetwork's users when a resource is downloaded.
Directory used to store metadata (in MEF format) when they are deleted.

If set, users will be able to register themselves. Self-registered users are assigned to the GUEST group. An email is sent to the user with their username and password enclosed using the feedback email information.
If metadata protocol is 'Data for download' then this service lets the user download the resource from GeoNetwork with no further user input - it is the simplest download interface

If metadata protocol is 'Data for download' then this service lets the user download the resource from GeoNetwork after they have agreed to accept any metadata constraints/generic disclaimer. The resource is bundled into a zip archive with an html description of the metadata constraints and a snapshot of the metadata record (as a MEF).
Selecting this option means that GeoNetwork will not handle file downloads.
If set, XLinks to metadata fragments in records will be resolved.
If set, Statistics on searches will be collected and stored in the database.
If set, the search language is automatically detected. Note that this doesn't work very well for short search terms.
Only return search results in the requested language.
Return search results in the requested language on top.
Ignore requested language for search results.

strings.java.vm.name: JVM name:
strings.os.name: System name:
